meanings.sent1: The old, wretcheder house stood abandoned on the hill.
meanings.sent2: She felt wretcheder than ever after losing her favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The wretcheder cat tried to catch its tail but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: The wretcheder storm clouds loomed ominously over the town.
meanings.sent5: The wretcheder smell from the garbage dump made everyone hold their noses.

meanings.definition: In a more wretched or miserable manner.
meanings.sent1: He sang wretcheder than anyone at the talent show.
meanings.sent2: She cried wretcheder when she heard the sad news.
meanings.sent3: The comedian told jokes wretcheder than a clown with a cold.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled wretcheder through the broken window.
meanings.sent5: The old man walked wretcheder with each passing year.
